alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Muscatine (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 2:41PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Muscatine and southeastern Cedar Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 241 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rochester, or 7 miles south of Tipton, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, minor flooding and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor tree limb damage and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Slowing or redirecting of traffic due to ponding or flowing water. Closure of waterfront access due to flooding. Locations impacted include... Tipton, Wilton, Rochester, Moscow, Tipton Matthews Airport, and Sunbury. This includes Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 261 and 276. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Stay away from flooded areas. Report any flooding to local law enforecement. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
